channel.title: Choosing a Blank Source
channel.description:
Hey all,
I see how I've been recommended to start with Hyperion, rune-source, and apollo before. But, how do I start? I don't know how they work because everything is seperated into its own file. So, this makes me wonder if I should start with something simple like Allstarscape/Delta/PI just to get the hang of Java? I really don't know much because I don't know how to put code into action, etc. If Hyperion still is the best choice for me, could someone help me out and show me how things work?
Thanks
P.S: What is a RS2Protocol?

item.title: Choosing a Blank Source
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

Thanks all for the help! I’m going to doodle around these servers and learn some things

Read full topic

item.title: Choosing a Blank Source
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:2, topic:545924”][quote author=AliAbid link=topic=664815.msg4444171#msg4444171 date=1407957365]
I see how I’ve been recommended to start with Hyperion, rune-source, and apollo before. But, how do I start? I don’t know how they work because everything is seperated into its own file. So, this makes me wonder if I should start with something simple like Allstarscape/Delta/PI just to get the hang of Java? I really don’t know much because I don’t know how to put code into action, etc.
[/quote]
no do not start with winterlove, just start with a master copy of runesource as its simple, clean, documented, and you’ll learn the basis of programming in java. you’ll also learn a bit about networking (I/O, ill explain what that means later).

read up on the actual java language here. yes, read every section. no, do not ‘skim’ through it because if you are at a low programming level you’ll miss out on lots of helpful information (ESPECIALLY the ‘variables’ section because it highlights instance and class variables, which is extremely important to know). each section is like a 2 minute read, read one or two a day.

remember if you don’t understand something, post here and we can help you.

If Hyperion still is the best choice for me, could someone help me out and show me how things work?

This might sound a little rude and I apologize but no one is going to go through the entire thing and teach you how it works. Play around with it and try and add basic things like skills, and whenever you see something in a class you don’t understand Google search it or post here.

If this is your first non-wL project then whatever you’re working on might not turn out to be that great, but you WILL get better.

Videos didn’t help me at all, but what did (and still does) really help me is asking questions, and reading the javadocs. Good luck

P.S: What is a RS2Protocol?

rs2 protocol = runescape 2 protocol

protocol: a set of rules governing the exchange or transmission of data between devices.

so basically the protocol is the way that data is sent to and recieved from the client. one thing that you NEED to understand is the basis of how runescape servers function is by SENDING (output/writing) data to and RECIEVING (input/reading) data from the client.

whenever you see people talking about “I(input)/O(output)” all they’re referring to is communication between the client and server. also note that a “packet” is data that’s being sent or received

another example is you might see these numbers a lot in the runescape servers part of the forums 317, 319, 377, 459, 474, 508, 525, etc. those are all different revisions and each of them have a different protocol (different packet structure, different way of doing things)

last example, god you better be reading all of this lol.

  • when you pickup an item, the client sends a packet to the server
  • when you drop an item, the client sends a packet to the server
  • when you want to send a message to the player in the chatbox, the server sends a packet to the client
  • when you want to display an object, the server sends a packet to the client

this will all start to make sense once you start playing around with the server, if you decide to use a good server that is. once you understand this you will already be ahead of most of the community. you are not going to become a programming genius after 1 or two months. this isn’t something you can just jump into (if you want to actually become good, fast). study the internals, learn how everything works and you should be fine bro!

once again, don’t feel like you’re being annoying. any questions you have, post em here[/quote]
lare96 for server help pls.

No really. If you could give that quality advice and help on other topics that’d be cool

Read full topic

VERY well put, if i could REP+ you i would!

Read full topic

@Clawz_fury wrote:

AliAbid:

I see how I’ve been recommended to start with Hyperion, rune-source, and apollo before. But, how do I start? I don’t know how they work because everything is seperated into its own file. So, this makes me wonder if I should start with something simple like Allstarscape/Delta/PI just to get the hang of Java? read up on the actual java language here. yes, read every section. no, do not ‘skim’ through it because if you are at a low programming level you’ll miss out on lots of helpful information (ESPECIALLY the ‘variables’ section because it highlights instance and class variables, which is extremely important to know). each section is like a 2 minute read, read one or two a day.

remember if you don’t understand something, post here and we can help you.

AliAbid:

If Hyperion still is the best choice for me, could someone help me out and show me how things work?

[quote=“lare69, post:3, topic:545562”]This might sound a little rude and I apologize but no one is going to go through the entire thing and teach you how it works. Play around with it and try and add basic things like skills, and whenever you see something in a class you don’t understand Google search it or post here.

If this is your first non-wL project then whatever you’re working on might not turn out to be that great, but you WILL get better.

Videos didn’t help me at all, but what did (and still does) really help me is asking questions, and reading the javadocs. Good luck :)[/quote]

AliAbid:

P.S: What is a RS2Protocol?

rs2 protocol = runescape 2 protocol

protocol: a set of rules governing the exchange or transmission of data between devices.

so basically the protocol is the way that data is sent to and recieved from the client. one thing that you NEED to understand is the basis of how runescape servers function is by SENDING (output/writing) data to and RECIEVING (input/reading) data from the client.

whenever you see people talking about “I(input)/O(output)” all they’re referring to is communication between the client and server. also note that a “packet” is data that’s being sent or received

another example is you might see these numbers a lot in the runescape servers part of the forums 317, 319, 377, 459, 474, 508, 525, etc. those are all different revisions and each of them have a different protocol (different packet structure, different way of doing things)

last example, god you better be reading all of this lol.

  • when you pickup an item, the client sends a packet to the server
  • when you drop an item, the client sends a packet to the server
  • when you want to send a message to the player in the chatbox, the server sends a packet to the client
  • when you want to display an object, the server sends a packet to the client

this will all start to make sense once you start playing around with the server, if you decide to use a good server that is. once you understand this you will already be ahead of most of the community. you are not going to become a programming genius after 1 or two months. this isn’t something you can just jump into (if you want to actually become good, fast). study the internals, learn how everything works and you should be fine bro!

once again, don’t feel like you’re being annoying. any questions you have, post em here

Read full topic
